unit.utterance: Teitei roho a peha vaan.
unit.utterance_translation: There was once a village.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Peha a vaan bona teitei peho vahara beiko
unit.utterance_translation: In this particular village there were little children

unit.utterance: ae a peha moon a gigo.
unit.utterance_translation: and a pregnant woman.

unit.utterance: E - erau a vahara beiko repaa nubu bono bai.
unit.utterance_translation: And so, the little children set off for a mango tree in the early morning.

unit.utterance: O bai bona he na sun nanaoana rakaha kahi nana bona vaan.
unit.utterance_translation: This mango tree stood very far away from the village.
unit.add_comments: "sun kahi" 'stand away from' is a transitive VC.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: E - peho taem mea si moon paa hino,
unit.utterance_translation: One day the woman asked,

unit.utterance: "Dee maa vareko ta bai!"
unit.utterance_translation: "Give me, please, a mango!"

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Meo vahara beiko paa sue,
unit.utterance_translation: And the little children said,

unit.utterance: "Ahiki ta bai, eam toro nao komana bata, eam toro nao pusu bai."
unit.utterance_translation: "There is no mango, you must go yourself, you must go to the foot of the mango tree."

unit.utterance: Merau mea si moon paa takaha peho vuri
unit.utterance_translation: And so the woman set off at dawn one day

unit.utterance: mepaa nao.
unit.utterance_translation: and went.

unit.utterance: Me naonao sana,
unit.utterance_translation: (She) walked very hard

unit.utterance: me nao me nao me nao, mepaa no tara bono pusu bai ei,
unit.utterance_translation: and walked and walked and walked, (until) (she) saw the foot of this mango tree,

unit.utterance: o bai karana - o bai sa - na vua nana.
unit.utterance_translation: the mango tree actually - the mango tree - was bearing fruit.

unit.utterance: Mepaa taneo tea tasu,
unit.utterance_translation: And (she) started to throw (a stick at the mango),

unit.utterance: tasu vai, ahiki ta bai,
unit.utterance_translation: (she) threw (at the mango), but there was not any mango (that fell down)

unit.utterance: vaabuaku ahiki ta bai, na vaakukan batana, a bai he kuu.
unit.utterance_translation: a second time, but there was not a mango, a third time, and a mango fell down.

unit.utterance: Kuu vai me paa mirin.
unit.utterance_translation: Fell down now and rolled.

unit.utterance: Me mirin me mirin, a moon vatete batana bona bai.
unit.utterance_translation: And rolled and rolled, the woman ran after the mango.

unit.utterance: Mirin, mirin me -
unit.utterance_translation: Rolled, rolled and -

unit.utterance: e roosuu he na hio maana matano avaava teve,
unit.utterance_translation: the giant was sitting in front of his cave,

unit.utterance: na sue maana, "Mirin bai, mirin bai, mirin bai."
unit.utterance_translation: he said, "Roll mango, roll mango, roll mango."

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: A moon vatete vakisi batana,
unit.utterance_translation: The woman was still running after (the mango),

unit.utterance: mepaa nao hopo me hopo varovarova teo hopo te roosuu.
unit.utterance_translation: and slipped inside and slipped inside, disappearing in the hole of the giant.

unit.utterance: Me roosuu paa sue ki bono matavus,
unit.utterance_translation: And the giant said to the door,

unit.utterance: "Tagan takapusu."
unit.utterance_translation: "Shut!"

unit.utterance: Meo matavus paa paas.
unit.utterance_translation: And the door shut.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Tei vai, a moon toku vai a tabae to paa tapakuu
unit.utterance_translation: Now (she) stayed (there), the woman did not know what had happened,

unit.utterance: me tei mea tavaan paa nagu me tea rake tea bon.
unit.utterance_translation: and (she) stayed (there) and the people also got tired of searching her in the night.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Meori nagu tea rake, vaabuaku o bon nagu,
unit.utterance_translation: And they got tired of searching, the second day (they) got tired,

unit.utterance: meori paa nagunagu tea rake meori paa umee bona moon.
unit.utterance_translation: and they got tired of searching and they abandoned the woman.

unit.utterance: Beera vai a bei- vahuhu vai a moon
unit.utterance_translation: The chi(ld) grew up - the woman gave birth now

unit.utterance: komano hopo mea beiko paa beera.
unit.utterance_translation: inside the cave and the child grew up.

unit.utterance: A beiko otei.
unit.utterance_translation: It was a boy.

unit.utterance: Me beera me beera maa,
unit.utterance_translation: And (he) grew bigger and bigger,

unit.utterance: me roosuu paa paku ki bona bona -
unit.utterance_translation: and the giant made him a -

unit.utterance: a vuhun.
unit.utterance_translation: a bow.

unit.utterance: Paku vai bona vuhun ore - me teitei koa mi bona vuhun bona komano hopo.
unit.utterance_translation: Made a bow so that - and he had this bow only inside the cave.

unit.utterance: Tei nana, tei, meori tei, mea beiko beera maa,
unit.utterance_translation: (There he) was staying, stayed and they stayed (on and on), and the child grew up.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Erau
unit.utterance_translation: Then,

unit.utterance: peho taem me roosuu paa sue, "Eam pasi tei nom, benaa nao tea vaahiipi,"
unit.utterance_translation: one day the giant said, "You will be staying (here) when I go pig hunting,"

unit.utterance: mepaa nao tea vaahiipi.
unit.utterance_translation: and (he) went hunting.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Mepaa nao tea vaahiipi me vaahiipi maa,
unit.utterance_translation: And (he) went hunting and (he) hunted,

unit.utterance: mea moon paa butara tea sue ki bono matavus,
unit.utterance_translation: and the woman tried to speak to the door,

unit.utterance: sue ki bono matavus,
unit.utterance_translation: said to the door,

unit.utterance: "Tagan taka -
unit.utterance_translation: "Open -

unit.utterance: takarata", meo matavus paa tamamata,
unit.utterance_translation: open," and the door opened,

unit.utterance: "Tagan takapus",
unit.utterance_translation: "Shut",

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Mea m- matavus paa
unit.utterance_translation: And the door

unit.utterance: paas vahaa.
unit.utterance_translation: shut again.

unit.utterance: Erau,
unit.utterance_translation: And so,

unit.utterance: mepaa - paa sue, "Eara kahi nao vaha rara vaan, a beiko paa beera vaevuru."
unit.utterance_translation: she said, "We will go back to the village, the child has already grown up."

unit.utterance: Orait, e Roosuu voos vai maa,
unit.utterance_translation: Alright, the giant came home now,

unit.utterance: hovo vaha vai maa teo avaava.
unit.utterance_translation: slipped back into the cave.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Hovo vaha koa maa,
unit.utterance_translation: Went again inside,

unit.utterance: sue vai, "Enaa paa dee mae guu."
unit.utterance_translation: (and) said, "I have brought a pig."

unit.utterance: Meori paa huraka bene guu, meori paa nahu meori an.
unit.utterance_translation: And they gutted the pig, cooked and ate (it).

unit.utterance: Me - a moon paa sue, "Enaa na karahu rakaha nom tea an amaa tabaan amaa marakua.
unit.utterance_translation: And - the woman said, "I am fed up eating unsalted food.

unit.utterance: Ean toro nao tea kana sa tahii, are ma nahu a guu vai bona tahii."
unit.utterance_translation: You must fetch some saltwater so that we can cook this pig with saltwater."

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Merau mepaa sue, "Bara, subunubu ne paa nao tea kana karaara sa tahii."
unit.utterance_translation: And so (he) said, "Well, tomorrow I'll go to fetch us some saltwater."

unit.utterance: Nao vai e Roosuu.
unit.utterance_translation: Now the giant went.

unit.utterance: Takaha koa mepaa nao mepaa nao.
unit.utterance_translation: Dawn just broke and (he) went and went.

unit.utterance: Nao mepaa mosi maa bono kururu.
unit.utterance_translation: Went and cut a bamboo.

unit.utterance: Meori paa [UNCLEAR]
unit.utterance_translation: They -

unit.utterance: mea moon paa sue, "Dee maa naa re dona."
unit.utterance_translation: and the woman said, "Bring (it) here so that I pierce the knots inside the bamboo."

unit.utterance: Mepaa dona bona me dona me pahin tabusu nao teo taena no kururu.
unit.utterance_translation: And she pierced and pierced its knots and directly got through to the bottom of the bamboo.

unit.utterance: O - merau mepaa sue,
unit.utterance_translation: And she said,

unit.utterance: "Bara ean kahi tagune, sahata, ean repaa nao tea kana sa tahii."
unit.utterance_translation: "Well, (when) you wake up, my dear, you'll go and fetch some saltwater."

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Mepaa nubu mepaa nao,
unit.utterance_translation: And (he) set off in the early morning and went,

unit.utterance: nao me nao me nao, a bua tom sinana he paa sue vaevuru,"Eara kahi nao vareko rara sahata.
unit.utterance_translation: went and went and went, while the mother said to her son, "Please, we'll go, dear.

unit.utterance: Gono koa a si vuhun tean, are nao."
unit.utterance_translation: Just get your bow, we'll go."

unit.utterance: Orait, me Roosuu peana tei maana kasuana,
unit.utterance_translation: Well, the giant was busy on the beach,

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: a bua tom sinana he taatagi koa mepaa sue ki bono matavus
unit.utterance_translation: while the mother and her son got ready, and (she) said to the door,

unit.utterance: "Tagan takarata."
unit.utterance_translation: "Tagan takarata."

unit.utterance: Meo matavus paa tamata vaevuru,
unit.utterance_translation: And the door opened,

unit.utterance: "Tagan takapusu."
unit.utterance_translation: "Tagan takapusu."

unit.utterance: Paas vahaa, a bua tom sinana paa taneo tea pita voosu.
unit.utterance_translation: (It) closed again, (and) mother and son started to walk home.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Meori nao meori nao meori nao, a beiko vavanavana batana, "Pistoo,
unit.utterance_translation: And the walked and walked and walked, the child was shooting (birds) along the way, "Pistoo,

unit.utterance: o pauna tenam bo Papa e Mokehiva."
unit.utterance_translation: our and Papa Mokehivas bananas."
unit.add_comments: The meaning of the direct speech is not clear.

unit.utterance: Nao vavanavana bata naona, meori paa vahus nao bona mohina te suburiori,
unit.utterance_translation: (He) was shooting while going along, and they approached their grandmother's garden,

unit.utterance: mepaa vana nao mepaa sue "Pistoo, pauna tenam bo Papa Mokehiva."
unit.utterance_translation: and (he) shot and said, "Pistoo, our banana tree and Papa Mokehiva."

unit.utterance: Me sumeke,
unit.utterance_translation: And the old man,

unit.utterance: subunae beiko vai paa sue,
unit.utterance_translation: the child's grandparent said,

unit.utterance: "Eh! Suburiori baitono roho,
unit.utterance_translation: "Hey! Their grandparent, listen

unit.utterance: a naovana tabae to dadao bata maana bene roosuu vai tea voora,
unit.utterance_translation: what kind of bird is calling this giant in the mountain,

unit.utterance: baitono nao."
unit.utterance_translation: listen."

unit.utterance: Baitono habana koa vai, a beiko he sue,
unit.utterance_translation: (She) heard the child saying,

unit.utterance: "Pistoo, o pauna tenam bo Papa e Mokehiva."
unit.utterance_translation: "Pistoo, our banana tree and Papa Mokehiva."

unit.utterance: Erau, "ta baitono, baitono!"
unit.utterance_translation: And then "Listen, listen!"

unit.utterance: nao vai, meori paa pita vahusu a bua tom sinana.
unit.utterance_translation: (he) went (on), and they walked close, the mother and her son.

unit.utterance: Meori pita meori pita, pita, pita,
unit.utterance_translation: And they walked and they walked, walked, walked,

unit.utterance: erau, mepaa vana habana koa a-
unit.utterance_translation: and so, (he) shot again, the -

unit.utterance: a be- a- a- e sumeke he
unit.utterance_translation: the ch- , while the old man

unit.utterance: na peha roho teo pauna
unit.utterance_translation: climbed onto the banana tree

unit.utterance: tea pampam bono pauna,
unit.utterance_translation: to bind the bananas (i.e. wrap the bunch of bananas with leaves to protect it from birds),

unit.utterance: kahi paku roho bona tabaan tea moon vai to rova roho.
unit.utterance_translation: (he) would make the food for this woman who had disappeared.

unit.utterance: Mepaa pampam nana, evehee vana habana koa nao,
unit.utterance_translation: And (he) was binding (the bananas), while (the boy) was just shooting again,

unit.utterance: "Pistoo, o pauna tenam bo Papa e Mokehiva."
unit.utterance_translation: "Pistoo, our banana tree and Papa Mokehiva."

unit.utterance: "Hih, a beiko, a beiko to sue bata maana bene Roosuu,
unit.utterance_translation: "Hih, a child, it's a child who is calling the giant,

unit.utterance: e Roosuu to paa tara bau vori."
unit.utterance_translation: they have perhaps seen the giant." (lit. what they have seen perhaps (was) the giant)

unit.utterance: Nomaa vai,
unit.utterance_translation: (They) came now,

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: nao vai, me - e - me - e - e sinanae a beiko paa sue, "Tara nao,
unit.utterance_translation: went, and - the child's mother said, "Look,
unit.add_comments: "sinanae a beiko" lit. 'his mother the child' is an unusual appositional construction.

unit.utterance: e s- bubuu tean to sun maana, e subuman to sun maana oioi."
unit.utterance_translation: your grandfather is standing there, your grandfather is standing over there." (lit. who is standing there (is) your grandfather)

unit.utterance: Nao vai, meori paa - a bua sumeke subuava paa sue,
unit.utterance_translation: (He) went, and they - the two, the old man (and) the old woman said,

unit.utterance: "Eh, a bua tom sinana."
unit.utterance_translation: "Hey, mother and child."

unit.utterance: Sun vai, eori he vainainana naori,
unit.utterance_translation: (They) stood (there), recognising them,

unit.utterance: meori paa tara nao bona bua tom sinana meori paa vakakao.
unit.utterance_translation: and they saw the mother and her son and they ran.

unit.utterance: Nao meori mee ri maa bari meori paa vahio ri bari tea mohina muu.
unit.utterance_translation: Went (there) and they took them (to their place) and they made them sit down in the taro garden.

unit.utterance: Meori paa sue, "Eara kahi voosu rara tea sivao."
unit.utterance_translation: And they said, "We will go home in the moonlight."

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
unit.utterance_translation: [PAUSE]

unit.utterance: Merau, voosu vai tea sivao meori paa vaahovo ri bari,
unit.utterance_translation: And so they went home in the moonlight and they let them go inside,

unit.utterance: vaahovo ri bari komana inu,
unit.utterance_translation: let them go inside the house,

unit.utterance: meori paa - me - e sumeke paa sue,
unit.utterance_translation: and they - and - the old man said,

unit.utterance: "Eara kahi vaavoosu ri rara a bua tom sinana to rova roho.
unit.utterance_translation: "We will let the mother and her son who had disappeared go home.

unit.utterance: Kakaku mao guu,
unit.utterance_translation: Butcher the pigs,

unit.utterance: matatopo a maamihu tabaan.
unit.utterance_translation: prepare all (kinds of) food.

unit.utterance: Eara kahi paku rara a tabaan
unit.utterance_translation: We will make the food

unit.utterance: tea bon."
unit.utterance_translation: in the night."

unit.utterance: Mea tavaan paa paku bona tabaan meori piuvu meo [UNCLEAR] takaku teo piuvu.
unit.utterance_translation: And the people made the food and they danced, and the [UNCLEAR] broke during the dance.

unit.utterance: Meori piuvu, meori piuvu meori vaatavus bona bua tom sinana,
unit.utterance_translation: And they danced and they danced and they let the mother and her son go outside (to present themselves in public),

unit.utterance: takaha vai,
unit.utterance_translation: dawn broke,

unit.utterance: meori paa tara bona bua tom sinana teo veoveo,
unit.utterance_translation: and they saw the mother and her son on the village square,

unit.utterance: merau me paa hana teo kara tete.
unit.utterance_translation: and so the story ends [idiomatic expression].
